meanings.definition: A sail set on a yard of a square-rigged ship above the course sail and sometimes below the topgallant sail.
meanings.sent1: The stunsail fluttered in the wind, adding extra speed to the ship.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the stunsail to catch the strong breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the stunsail, thinking it was a cozy perch.
meanings.sent4: Like a graceful dancer, the stunsail pirouetted in the ocean breeze.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red stunsail contrasted beautifully against the blue sky.

meanings.sent1: The captain ordered the crew to stunsail the ship for increased speed.
meanings.sent2: Sailors stunsail by attaching the additional sail to the yard.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, they accidentally stunsailed the wrong side of the ship.
meanings.sent4: The ship seemed to stunsail effortlessly through the waves.
meanings.sent5: With precision, the crew stunsailed the ship, harnessing the power of the wind.
